metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9115 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low.
metadata.Description:
In OpenEXR 2.2.0, an invalid write of size 2 in the = operator function in half.h could cause the application to crash or execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9115` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenexr24 - 2.3.0-6ubuntu0.1
openexr - 2.3.0-6ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> see suse bug for reproducer with exrmakepreview first patch in upstream bug doesn't cover this CVE  The patch for this issue was dropped during the focal development cycle by mistake.

criterions.comment: openexr package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-6ubuntu0.1').
